name: Feature Film "Field Sketches" Toronto Theatrical Premiere
description:
A personal film from director, write, producer Carl Bessai.

What matters most to a person? The film is about Peter (played by actor Vincent Gale), a middle-aged architect whose business and personal life are imploding, has been trying to return to his creative roots as an architect.  His successful partnership with his college friend Bruce (played by actor David Cubitt) has left him feeling disillusioned, and Peter decides to move to his family farm and spend the winter in Saskatchewan. 

The film features Canadian actors June Laporte, Sara Canning, Tanaya Beatty, Ben Cotton, Iain Belcher, Ben Immanuel, David Cubitt, and Gabrielle Rose. Carl Bessai and Vincent Gale will attend the screenings, followed by a talkback session, hosted by former TIFF programmer Steve Gravestock. 

Carl, a long-time resident of Toronto now based in Vancouver, BC, sharing time between Toronto and Los Angeles, is thrilled to bring his twentieth film to Toronto.

name: Glimmer - a Personal and Shared Exploration of Queerness
description:
A new trans-disciplinary, concert-length work by award-winning composer Thierry Tidrow that explores the many layers and interpretations of queerness through classical music and narrative text. 

Commissioned by New Music Concerts, and presented at Buddies in Bad Times Theatre, this intimate, autobiographical piece brings together text, music, and staging created by an all-queer team of performers and musicians.

name: Stop the Bleed
description:
This program has prepared nearly 4 million people worldwide on how to stop bleeding in a severely injured person.

With 3 quick actions, you can be trained to save a life. The number one cause of preventable death after injury is bleeding. The course is taught by staff from the St. Michael's Hospital Trauma and Emergency Medicine Programs. No medical or other training is required to take the course. 

There is no minimum age requirement for the course, although we recommend a parent or guardian to be aware that there are graphic images and content covered in the course.

name: Uncovering the CETA Opportunity - EU Market

location.name: North York Civic Centre - Council Chambers

description:
The City of Toronto is hosting a half-day event to highlight the importance of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) between Canada and the European Union and how CETA can benefit Toronto region businesses through new and expanded opportunities in the EU. This event will bring together key stakeholders, government officials and trade experts for a morning of insightful discussions and networking opportunities.

WHY THE EUROPEAN UNION?
The EU market, consisting of 27 member states, is Canada's second-largest global trading partner for goods and services.
In 2023, trade in Canada-EU combined goods and services reached a value of $157.3 billion.

name: Circus Cabaret…It’s Shirley Happening!
description: Come one, come all to this extravaganza! Step right up and meet ringmaster Dame Shirley Happening, your drag hostess with the mostess. Within the wondrous three-ring circus of life, you will be led on an unforgettable high-wire act of song, dance, dazzling costumes, comedy and audience antics. Get ready to participate in the merriment with special guest appearance by Tony Astri.

name: Music In the Park Series 2025

location.name: Gazebo in Centennial Park (across from Medieval Times at the foot of Dufferin St)

description:
A summer concert series for everyone to enjoy live performances each night by two different incredible emerging and established Toronto musicians. Plus, shop from community vendors and grab tasty bites from local food vendors!

Bring your friends, bring a blanket, pack a picnic, and settle in for a night of great music under the gazebo. 

Don’t forget to share your experience using #MyExPlace and #ParkdaleRA on social media for a chance to be featured!

organizer.name: The ExPlace and The Parkdale Residents' Assoc. (PRA)
